title: Quiz 9: Diabetes & Foot Care
topicName: Essential Knowledge and Skills for Healthcare Assistants
description: Evaluate understanding of diabetes management and the diabetic foot examination.

questions.question: Type 2 diabetes is primarily associated with ___BLANK___ resistance and accounts for 90% of cases.
questions.explanation: Type 2 is characterized by insulin resistance or relative lack of insulin.

questions.question: What is the single most important risk factor for the development of a diabetic foot ulcer?
questions.explanation: If a patient cannot feel pain (LOPS), they are unaware of injuries, leading to ulcers.

questions.question: Which pulses should be palpated during a diabetic foot examination? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Dorsalis Pedis (top of foot) and Posterior Tibial (ankle) are the key foot pulses.

questions.question: What device is used to test for Loss of Protective Sensation (LOPS) on the sole of the foot?
questions.explanation: A 10g monofilament applies a specific pressure to test nerve sensation.

questions.question: Order the steps of a Diabetic Foot Exam:
questions.explanation: Standard sequence: Inspection -> Vascular -> Sensory -> Risk Classification.
questions.hint: Look, Feel pulses, Feel sensation, Decide risk.

questions.question: Charcot Foot is a rare deformity caused by severe neuropathy where bones weaken and fracture.
questions.explanation: Charcot foot ('rocker bottom' foot) is a serious complication of neuropathy.
questions.hint: It causes the foot to change shape.

questions.question: Match the Diabetes Risk Classification with the Action (NICE 2015):

pairs.right: Refer to podiatrist (within 1-3 months, frequent review)
Refer to multidisciplinary foot care service within 1 working day

questions.explanation: Risk levels dictate urgency of referral. Active ulcers need immediate specialist care.

options.text: Glycated haemoglobin indicating average blood glucose over 3-4 months

questions.question: Type 1 Diabetes can be reversed by diet and exercise.
questions.explanation: Type 1 is autoimmune and requires lifelong insulin. Type 2 can sometimes be reversed with weight loss.
questions.hint: Type 1 involves destruction of pancreas cells.

questions.question: Why should diabetics NOT use corn plasters?

options.text: They can damage healthy skin and cause ulcers due to neuropathy

questions.explanation: Corn plasters contain acid. If a patient has neuropathy, they won't feel the acid burning healthy skin, leading to ulcers.
